attributes.additional_details: Two points. 1 charge drivers from europe a tax at the port a arrival to use the roads that we all pay for .2 charge a tax of say £50 for every caravan on the road,the knock on effect of this might be every caravan woukd need insurance and a certificate like an mot that when asked for needed to be produced,this in my estimation could make lots of money for the government and the knock on effects might be put into lowering the price of fuel for everyone, lets face it towing a caravan uses more fuel ,and if someone from europe is towing its a win win situation !hope every one who read this can see he logic.
